intro: Rolliniopsis leptopetala, commonly known as the slender-leaved rolliniopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries such as Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Rolliniopsis leptopetala is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests or rocky slopes.
